status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
js8544 opened a new pull request, #14230:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14230

   When the output type of an expression is of variable length, e.g. string, Gandiva would realloc the output buffer to make space for new outputs for each row. When num of rows is high some memory allocators perform poorly.
   
   We can use the std::vector like approach to amortize the allcation cost. First allocate some initial space depending on the input size. Each time we run out of space, double the buffer size. In the end shrink it to fit the actual size. Arrow string builder also uses this approach.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #14230:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14230#issuecomment-1257028983

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

js8544 commented on PR #14230:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14230#issuecomment-1257029258

   I've tested the performance with a newly added benchmark TimedTestOutputStringAllocs. 
   On my machine, it changes from 361038us to 290553us for jemalloc, and 6765325us to 291024us. Huge improvement for mimalloc.

kou commented on PR #14230:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14230#issuecomment-1257487283

   Thanks!

ursabot commented on PR #14230:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14230#issuecomment-1257588635

fields.description:
When the output type of an expression is of variable length, e.g. string, Gandiva would realloc the output buffer to make space for new outputs for each row. When num of rows is high some memory allocators perform poorly.

We can use the std::vector like approach to amortize the allcation cost. First allocate some initial space depending on the input size. Each time we run out of space, double the buffer size. In the end shrink it to fit the actual size. Arrow string builder also uses this approach.
fields.summary: [C++][Gandiva] Implement preallocation for variable length output buffer
